blogs.title: 23andMe finds evidence that blood type plays a role in COVID-19
blogs.summary: Preliminary data from 23andMe’s ongoing genetic study of COVID-19 appears to lend more evidence for the importance of a person’s blood type — determined by the ABO gene — in differences in the susceptibility to the virus.23andMe is still recruiting for its

blogs.title: People with O-type blood are almost 20% less likely to test positive for coronavirus, research suggests
blogs.summary:
Having a certain blood type may help protect you against the new coronavirus, preliminary data from a new study suggest.
Researchers from genetic testing company 23andMe found that people with type O blood were up to 18 percent less likely to test positiv

Your risk of severe COVID-19 may be affected by blood type, new genetic analysis suggests

People with blood type O may have a reduced risk of developing severe symptoms

blogs.title: COVID-19 and blood type: What's the link?
blogs.summary: Scientists are finding evidence that blood type may be a risk factor for COVID-19. In one study, people with Type A blood were more likely to be hospitalized.

blogs.title: Covid-19 Risk Doesn’t Depend (Much) on Blood Type, New Studies Find
blogs.summary: New studies show that people with Type A blood are not at greater risk of getting sick, as previous studies had suggested.

blogs.title: Your Blood Type May Affect COVID-19 Risk, But It's No Kind of Protection, Experts Say
